docs.title: Procedural CAD Gems: A CadQuery Collection
docs.text:
Welcome to a gallery of parametric 3D models where code meets engineering and art.

Unlike traditional CAD software where you draw with a mouse, every object in this collection is "baked" from Python scripts using the CadQuery framework. Instead of static files, these are living algorithms that can generate infinite variations of a design just by changing a few variables.

docs.title: Why Procedural CAD?
docs.text:
• Precision through Logic: Geometry is defined by mathematical relationships, ensuring perfect symmetry and alignment (e.g., in the Hyperboloid Lattice).
  • Infinite Scalability: Need a staircase with 10 steps or 100? Just update the n_steps parameter and the model rebuilds itself instantly.
  • Algorithmic Creativity: Some shapes, like the Voronoi Shattered Cube, would be nearly impossible to model manually, but are simple for a well-written script.
  • Version Control Ready: Since these models are code, they can be tracked, branched, and improved using Git, just like any other software project.

docs.title: How to Explore
docs.text:

  2. Interactive 3D Preview: Powered by , allowing you to inspect the geometry, shadows, and reflections directly in your browser.

docs.title: Voronoi Fragmentation Generator (Shattered Geometry)
docs.text: source

docs.title: Description
docs.text: An algorithmic tool for breaking down any solid object into unique, interlocking shards using 3D Voronoi partitioning. This model showcases a "shattered" effect where a base volume is intersected with randomly generated Voronoi cells. It is perfect for procedural destruction effects, architectural puzzles, or artistic "exploded" views in web applications.

docs.title: Key Features:
docs.text:
1. Randomized Sharding: Uses a point-cloud seed to generate unique fracture patterns every time the script runs.
  2. Boolean Intersections: Leverages CadQuery’s robust kernel to create clean, sharp edges between shards.
  3. Individual Shard Control: Every fragment is an independent solid, allowing for individual animation or removal (e.g., "throwing away 40% of pieces").
  4. Customizable Complexity: Easily scale from a few large chunks to hundreds of tiny splinters.

docs.title: Dimensions
docs.text:
Bounding Box: (calculated from a string of text)

Shard Density: Variable (Controlled by the number of seed points)

docs.title: Procedural Disco Ball (Mirror Ball)
docs.text: source

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A mathematically generated disco ball consisting of multiple flat rectangular facets mapped onto a spherical surface. This model demonstrates the power of coordinate transformation in CadQuery, where simple 2D tiles are precisely positioned in 3D space to form a perfectly faceted sphere. Ideal for testing PBR (Physically Based Rendering) materials and environment reflections.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
1. Adjustable Facet Density: Control the number of mirrors by changing the longitudinal and latitudinal segments.
  2. Perfect Spherical Mapping: Facets are calculated to maintain a consistent gapless structure.
  3. Rendering Optimized: Each facet is a flat surface, maximizing the "glitter" effect when used with environment maps (HDRI).
  4. Manifold Geometry: Despite having many faces, the model is a clean, watertight solid.

docs.title: Dimensions (Default)
docs.text:
Radius: 40 mm

Facet Count: 20 X 13 individual faces

docs.title: Glass
docs.text: source

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A stunning geometric structure based on a hyperboloid of one sheet. This model demonstrates how a complex curved surface can be created using only straight lines (rods). It is a "ruled surface," where every point on the surface belongs to at least one straight line. This principle allows for the creation of incredibly strong and lightweight architectural structures like the famous Shukhov Tower.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Ruled Surface Geometry: The lattice is generated by rotating straight lines at a specific angle, following the mathematical formula:
\[\frac{x^2 + y^2}{a^2} - \frac{z^2}{c^2} = 1\]
  • Dynamic Density: Easily adjust the number of intersecting rods to create either a dense mesh or a light, airy frame.
  • Structural Parameters: Control the top/bottom radii and the "waist" diameter to change the curvature of the tower.Circular Support Rings: Includes top and bottom reinforcing rings for a complete structural look.

docs.title: Dimensions (Default)
docs.text:
1. Base Radius: 50 mm
  2. Total Height: 120 mm
  3. Rod Diameter: 2 mm

docs.title: Description
docs.text: An intricate architectural section featuring traditional Indo-Islamic (Mughal) arches. This model showcases the use of complex boolean operations and patterns in CadQuery to create ornamental details. It is designed as a modular unit that can be repeated to form a grand palace facade or a decorative interior wall.

docs.title: Key Features:
docs.text:
• Multifoil Arch Design: Features a precisely calculated "pointed" arch with decorative inner cutouts.
  • Modular Symmetry: The section is perfectly aligned for tiling, allowing for the easy creation of long corridors or buildings.
  • Recessed Geometry: Multi-layered boolean subtractions create a sense of depth and shadow, perfect for testing HDR lighting.
  • Decorative Moldings: Includes subtle circular and rectangular ornaments typical of classical architecture.

docs.title: Dimensions:
docs.text:
Section Width: 10 mm Wall Thickness: 2 mm Arch Height: 20 mm

docs.title: Parametric Spiral Staircase Generator
docs.text: source

docs.title: Description:
docs.text: A fully procedural spiral staircase model generated using CadQuery. This script automates the creation of a classic helical stair structure, featuring a central support column and radially arranged treads. The geometry is optimized for 3D printing and architectural visualization, ensuring a seamless connection between the steps and the central axis.

docs.title: Key Features:
docs.text:
1. Fully Parametric Design: Easily adjust the total height, radius, and number of steps by modifying simple variables in the script.
  2. Automated Step Rotation: The algorithm automatically calculates the necessary rotation angle for each tread based on the step count to ensure a full or partial turn.
  3. Integrated Central Column: Steps are fused to a central pole, creating a sturdy, single-piece solid suitable for FDM/SLA printing.
  4. Clean Topology: Constructed using solid geometry primitives for error-free export to STEP and STL formats.

docs.title: Dimensions (Default):
docs.text:
Total Height: 40

Step Width: 8

Step Thickness: 2.5

Central Pole Diameter: 4

docs.title: Taj-Mahal
docs.text: source

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A full assembly of a classic umbrella, demonstrating the integration of multiple distinct parts into a single cohesive model. This script uses a combination of revolution, sweeping, and shelling to create the canopy, the shaft, and the ergonomic "J-style" handle.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Spherical Canopy: Created using a thin shell operation for realistic thickness.
  • Multi-Part Assembly: Separate logic for the canopy, the shaft, and the handle, allowing for easy material assignment (e.g., fabric vs. wood).
  • Ergonomic Handle: A smooth "J" curve generated using a sweep along a wire, demonstrating path-based modeling.
  • Adjustable Curvature: The depth and span of the canopy can be tuned for different styles (from a sun parasol to a deep rain umbrella).

docs.title: Dimensions
docs.text:
1. Canopy Diameter: 100 mm (default)
  2. Total Length: 95 mm
  3. Handle Radius: 10 mm

docs.title: Parametric High-Voltage Transmission Tower (U35 Type)
docs.text: source

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A detailed procedural model of a lattice steel transmission tower, commonly used in 35kV high-voltage power lines. Unlike static 3D assets, this model is built using a mathematical approach where every cross-brace and section is calculated based on structural logic. The design features a classic four-legged tapering trunk with cross-arms (traverse) optimized for electrical clearance.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Geometric Similarity Logic: The lattice sections are generated using triangle similarity algorithms, ensuring perfectly aligned bracing as the tower tapers toward the top.
  • Modular Truss Structure: Includes the main trunk, ground wire peak, and cross-arms for conductor suspension.
  • Standard-Based Design: Modeled after industrial blueprints (U35 series), maintaining realistic proportions for height, base width, and traverse span.
  • Clean Topology for Analysis: Built using solid primitives, making the model suitable for FEA (Finite Element Analysis) or clear architectural visualization.

docs.title: Dimensions (Default U35-3 Specs)
docs.text:
1. Total Height: 23.5 meters
  2. Base Width: 5.4 meters
  3. Number of Sections: 5 main segments + peak
  4. Profile: Square-section framing (optimized for CAD performance)
